definition: to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station

sentences.english: We had two Pullman cars and a 70-foot baggage car.
sentences.chinese: 我们有两个卧铺车厢和一辆70英尺长的行李车。

sentences.english: Hello, I'd like to reserve a single berth ticket from Shanghai to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 你好，我想预定由上海去北京的单程卧铺票一张。

sentences.english: I want a berth to Gaoxiong tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 我要一张明天晚上去高雄的卧铺票。

sentences.english: Sorry, sleepers are all sold out. We have only soft seats left.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，卧铺票已经卖完了，只有软座。

sentences.english: I want to reserve a berth of second class cabin.
sentences.chinese: 我想预计一张二等舱的卧铺票。

sentences.english: I'd like to reserve a sleeper to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 我想预定一张去加拿大的卧铺票。

sentences.english: Ming and Zhao Shan take berth tickets to Shenyang.
sentences.chinese: 明和赵姗坐上了回沈阳的卧铺车。

sentences.english: Great Britain has only two sleeper trains.
sentences.chinese: 大不列颠只有两条卧铺列车线路，都是快客。

sentences.english: The Red level offers either a tiny sleeping alcove or a reclining seat.
sentences.chinese: 红色等有卧铺或靠背可放下的坐席。

sentences.english: B:Do you want a berth or a compartment?
He stepped out of his first-class "sleeper" on the night express from London.
sentences.chinese: 他从由伦敦开来的午夜快车的头等卧铺车厢里走出来。
两张卧铺票还是座位票？

sentences.english: In that case, it is better for you to book the berth ticket for Hangzhou instead of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，您最好买到杭州的卧铺票，不要买上海的。

sentences.english: I want to book a sleeper ticket for chicago.
sentences.chinese: 我不需要卧铺，可软座我是要的。

sentences.english: He stepped out of his first-class sleeper on the night express from London.
sentences.chinese: 他从由伦敦开来的午夜快车的头等卧铺车厢里走出来。

definition: soft sleeper (a type of sleeper train ticket class with a softer bunk)
hard sleeper (a type of sleeper train ticket class with a harder bunk)
green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
soft seat (= first class in PRC trains)
